title: October 27 - November 11, 2025
summary: Sora character cameos announced, Weavy-Figma integration transforms enterprise workflows, Udio sells to Universal Music Group, major community additions with Linus Ekenstam and Anya Neuhaus, comprehensive Veo 3.1 camera control techniques, and Chris First goes full-time AI.
keyHighlights: Sora character cameos feature announced by Chad Nelson
Weavy-Figma integration revolutionizes enterprise AI adoption
Udio acquired by Universal Music Group, downloads disabled
Linus Ekenstam and Anya Neuhaus join RealDreams community
Comprehensive Veo 3.1 camera control tutorials and workflows
Chris First quits day job to pursue AI full-time

highlightTopic.title: üé≠ Sora Character Cameos Revolution
highlightTopic.description: Chad Nelson announced the upcoming Sora character cameos feature, describing it as "super fast, super easy and super dooooooper fun." The feature will allow creators to make characters and publish meme feeds, with the app promoting the most popular characters. Enterprise API access will follow the initial release, enabling companies to create cameos for their IP either publicly or for private use. The announcement sparked excitement about creating a RealDreams micro drama and democratizing character-driven content creation.

items.title: üé≠ Sora Character Cameos Feature Announced
items.overview: OpenAI's Sora will soon support character cameos for consistent character generation.
items.description: Chad Nelson revealed that character cameos are coming soon to Sora, emphasizing the feature is "super fast, super easy and super dooooooper fun." The app will promote the most popular characters, creating a new ecosystem for AI-generated character content. Enterprise API access will be available later, allowing companies to create cameos for their intellectual property either for public use or private applications. The announcement generated significant excitement, with Justin Hackney proposing a RealDreams micro drama and Chad jokingly threatening to make Justin into a muppet character.

items.title: üé® Weavy-Figma Integration Launches
items.overview: Weavy announces integration with Figma, transforming enterprise AI workflow adoption.
items.description: Weavy announced its integration with Figma, creating a powerful combination for enterprise AI workflows. Rory Flynn celebrated that his "two most used platforms" are now unified, noting this makes corporate sell-in of AI tools significantly easier since teams can simply use their existing Figma accounts. Billy Boman praised Weavy for being "not just another lazy ComfyUI wrapper, but an actually thought out product balancing good UX and UI while making complex AI workflows more accessible." The integration is particularly valuable for traditional creatives who understand layers, compositing, and nodes from tools like After Effects, Nuke, and Houdini. Ludovic and Rory confirmed that more corporate contacts are requesting Weavy, with Rory noting it's "the only tool that's been universally accepted at the corporate level." The timing follows Adobe's pivot toward nodal workflows, with Chrissie praising founders Itay and Lior for building a great product that "genuinely deserved this."

items.title: üéµ Udio Acquired by Universal Music Group
items.overview: AI music platform Udio sells to UMG, immediately disables downloads, sparking backlash.
items.description: Blvckl!ght broke the news that Udio has been acquired by Universal Music Group and immediately disabled download functionality, causing significant user backlash. He noted that the move "totally killed their valuation overnight" with people online "pisssssed." Rory Flynn confirmed he was having download issues that morning, which now made sense. Blvckl!ght shared a workaround using inspect element to search for and download tracks from the code itself. The acquisition, combined with Stability AI also going to UMG, signals what Rory called "the great consolidation" of AI creative tools into major entertainment conglomerates.

items.title: üë®‚Äçüíº Lovis Odin Joins Fal.ai Team
items.overview: Community member announces new role at AI infrastructure company.
items.description: Lovis Odin announced he's joining Fal.ai, a company he described as "the fastest way to serve AI models." The community congratulated him, with Edmond Yang noting "I've been using Fal for a while now - it's a great service!" and Rory Flynn adding "Congrats!" The move represents continued professional growth within the RealDreams community as members transition into key roles at AI companies.

items.title: üì∞ Olly Ginelli Featured in Hollywood Reporter
items.overview: Community member's work highlighted in major entertainment industry publication.
items.description: Olly Ginelli shared that he was featured in The Hollywood Reporter discussing AI-generated film festival submissions. The article represents mainstream entertainment industry recognition of AI filmmaking work from the RealDreams community.

items.title: üèÜ Dor Awards Winners Announced
items.overview: AI film industry awards recognize outstanding creative work.
items.description: The Dor Awards announced winners across multiple categories celebrating AI filmmaking. Winners included Grimes for Best Music Video, Beeple for Best Visual Effects, and Logan Paul for Best Short Film. The awards represent growing recognition and formalization of AI creative work as a distinct category in entertainment.

items.title: ü§ñ Tesla Optimus Robot Event Controversy
items.overview: Debate over authenticity of Tesla's humanoid robot demonstration.
items.description: Discussion emerged around Tesla's Optimus robot event, with questions about whether the robots were fully autonomous or remotely operated. Matthieu shared footage asking "is this real?" while others debated the level of AI versus human control. The conversation reflected broader industry discussions about authenticity and transparency in AI demonstrations.

items.title: üì± Google Pomelli Launch
items.overview: Google releases automated social media ad creation platform.
items.description: Google launched Pomelli, a platform for automated social media ad creation. The tool represents Google's entry into AI-powered creative automation for advertising, though specific features and capabilities were not detailed in the discussion.

items.title: üéØ Chris First Goes Full-Time AI
items.overview: Prominent community member quits day job to pursue AI filmmaking full-time.
items.description: Chris First announced he's quitting his day job to pursue AI filmmaking full-time, marking a significant career transition. The announcement represents the growing viability of AI creative work as a primary career path, with Chris joining others in the community who have made similar transitions.

items.title: üé® Adobe MAX Conference Highlights
items.overview: Major announcements and showcases from Adobe's annual creativity conference.
items.description: Adobe MAX featured significant AI creative work showcases, including David Clark's presentations. The conference highlighted Adobe's continued push into AI-powered creative tools and the integration of AI workflows into traditional creative software.

items.title: ‚ö° Extropic AI Efficiency Breakthrough
items.overview: Startup announces 10,000x efficiency improvement in AI processing.
items.description: Extropic AI announced a breakthrough achieving 10,000x efficiency improvement in AI processing. The advancement represents significant progress in making AI tools more accessible and cost-effective for creators. The technology could dramatically reduce rendering times and costs for AI video generation.

items.title: üé® Comfy UI Integration for Photoshop
items.overview: Fillip announces ComfyUI workflow integration directly in Photoshop.
items.description: Fillip shared that ComfyUI workflows can now be integrated directly into Photoshop, bridging the gap between traditional creative tools and AI workflows. The integration allows Photoshop users to access powerful ComfyUI capabilities without leaving their familiar environment.

items.title: üé¨ Mosaic.so Video Editing Platform
items.overview: New AI-powered video editing platform launches.
items.description: Mosaic.so launched as a new AI-powered video editing platform. The tool aims to streamline video editing workflows with AI assistance, though specific features were not detailed in the initial announcement.

items.title: üé® Leonardo Lucid Origin Model
items.overview: Leonardo AI releases new Lucid Origin image generation model.
items.description: Leonardo AI announced the Lucid Origin model, their latest image generation offering. The model represents continued advancement in AI image generation capabilities with improved quality and control features.

items.title: üîç Magnific Sublime Upscaling
items.overview: New upscaling model from Magnific with enhanced quality.
items.description: Magnific released Sublime, a new upscaling model offering enhanced quality for image enhancement. The tool builds on Magnific's reputation for high-quality AI upscaling with improved detail preservation and artifact reduction.

items.title: üé® Seedream for Consistency
items.overview: Tool recommended for maintaining visual consistency across generations.
items.description: Seedream emerged as a recommended tool for maintaining visual consistency across AI generations. Community members highlighted its effectiveness for stylized work alongside Veo, particularly for projects requiring consistent character or style representation.

items.title: üé¨ Wan 2.2 Animate
items.overview: Alibaba's Wan 2.2 Animate for human performance integration.
items.description: Wan 2.2 Animate was recommended as the best tool for integrating human performances into AI films. The workflow involves recreating actors with Seedream, lining them up with the performance, and letting the performance drive the AI version. Multiple community members noted it works better than Act2 for this specific use case.

items.title: üé• Veo 3.1 Camera Control - Multi-Step Workflow
items.overview: Alex shares advanced technique for achieving locked camera shots in Veo 3.1.

tutorial.problem: *Billy Boman struggled with keeping camera locked/static in Veo 3.1, finding that even prompts like "Camera is locked/static/fixed" resulted in camera tracking.*
tutorial.solution: *Alex provided a detailed multi-step solution for achieving truly static camera shots.*

steps.title: Step 1: Initial Render
steps.content: *Do a normal text-to-video render in Veo 3.1.*

steps.title: Step 2: Frame Extraction
steps.content: *Extract the first frame and use it as BOTH the first and last frame in Veo. This doesn't give exactly the desired content, but provides enough motion to work with.*

steps.title: Step 3: Motion Control
steps.content: *Extract an end frame that stops camera movement from the result.*

steps.title: Step 4: Final Render
steps.content: *Use the original first frame along with this new end frame for the final render to achieve a locked camera shot.*

tutorial.result: *Billy was amazed, asking "Damn, never even seen this? Where is this? In the scene editor?" and thanking Alex for the "smart approach."*

items.title: üé• Veo 3.1 Camera Control - Prompt Techniques
items.overview: Community shares effective prompting strategies for static camera shots.

techniques.title: "Locked-Off" Prompt:
techniques.content: *Jovardi recommended using "locked-off" which "usually works for me."*

techniques.title: "Mounted Camera" Prompt:
techniques.content: *Rory Flynn suggested "mounted camera" or "mounted camera fixed on an [location]" as effective prompts.*

tutorial.caveat: *Billy Boman noted that while these techniques generally work, he encountered a specific scene with a dragon where "no matter the prompt the camera just tracks the crap out of the dragon." The discussion highlighted that camera control can be scene-dependent and may require multiple approaches.*

items.title: üé® 2D Animation Tool Selection Guide
items.overview: Comprehensive breakdown of best tools for different 2D animation needs.

tutorial.question: *Edmond Yang asked for go-to 2D animation tools.*

recommendations.title: Hailuo (Best Overall):
recommendations.content: *Alex: "Hailuo is currently the best one imho." Use Hailuo 2.0 "when you want a lot of movement" and 2.3 "for quieter/more controlled scenes." It "does wonders for anime."*

recommendations.title: Kling 2.1:
recommendations.content: *Jordan Daniel Chesney suggested Kling 2.1 as a solid choice.*

recommendations.title: Veo & Seedance:
recommendations.content: *Billy Boman: "Veo n Seedance is pretty good allaround models for Stylized."*

tutorial.debate: *Billy Boman countered that "most Hailuo has been a morph bonanza for me - sacrificing lots of movement for consistency/clarity," though he acknowledged this was from "not very rigorous testing." Alex clarified he doesn't use it for photorealistic work but specifically for anime.*

items.title: üé¨ N8N Automation for Sora 2 Max Batch Rendering
items.overview: Complete automation workflow for batch video generation with spreadsheet integration.

tutorial.overview: *KƒìkƒÅ built and shared a comprehensive N8N automation that pulls from a spreadsheet of prompts, uses Sora 2 Max on Higgsfield, saves to a folder, and updates the sheet.*

setup.title: Requirements:
setup.content: *Point to your spreadsheet and add your Higgsfield API key.*

setup.title: Access:
setup.content: *KƒìkƒÅ offered to DM the JSON file to anyone interested. Complete files and instructions published at the Notion link.*

tutorial.flexibility: *The automation is highly flexible - you can change from Sora 2 Max to other models on Higgsfield by modifying the nodes, or replace the Higgsfield node entirely with other platforms like Replicate or any service with an API.*

items.title: üé¨ Topaz Video Upscaling - ProRes Workflow
items.overview: Codec selection eliminates transition artifacts in long-form video upscaling.

tutorial.question: *Winston Mayo asked about upscaling 5-minute AI videos instead of 30-second clips.*
tutorial.experience: *Gabe Michael shared his experience using Topaz for a 6-minute video from 720 to 4K, noting "it takes awhile and they add a weird frame between scenes that needs to be cleaned up, but it upscaled quite nice."*

solution.title: The Fix:
solution.content: *ChristianF: "If you output your original video as ProRes instead of MP4, the weird transition frames between scene changes are gone."*

solution.title: Why It Works:
solution.content: *"Because of the intraframe prores codec vs. the interframe MP4 codec." Gabe confirmed this made sense.*

tutorial.performance_note: *Winston attempted the process but reported "it's giving 30 days as the rendering time," leading Chrissie to suggest "try rendering in the cloud" for faster processing.*

items.title: üì± Sora Cameo Access Workaround for UK Users
items.overview: Step-by-step method for accessing Sora Cameo feature from restricted regions.

tutorial.problem: *Georgia asked how to create a Sora cameo while in the UK, noting that VPN access through browser was requesting the app which she couldn't download.*

solution.title: The Workaround:
solution.content: *Billy Boman: "U need to change country on the app store on your iPhone, no VPN needed - you only need it for the web."*

solution.title: Process:
solution.content: *"Then from there you can do the cameo filming yourself on the phone and use it on the web."*

tutorial.result: *The workaround allows users in restricted regions to access the full Cameo functionality by leveraging the mobile app's capabilities.*

items.title: ‚úçÔ∏è ChatGPT Writing - Removing Em-Dashes
items.overview: Custom instruction eliminates AI writing tell-tale em-dash overuse.

tutorial.discovery: *Billy Boman shared a "pretty neat trick for Chat GPT writing" to eliminate the dead giveaway em-dashes that AI often uses.*

method.title: The Custom Instruction:
method.content: *Add this to custom instructions under personalisation in settings: "Systematically replace em-dashes ("‚Äî") with a dot (".") to start a new sentence, or a comma (",") to continue the sentence."*

method.title: Billy's Reaction:
method.content: *"I wasn't even aware that setting existed!"*

tutorial.mixed_results: *Chrissie reported: "I have this in my custom instructions but it never listens and ALWAYS adds em dashes," comparing it to "the 'I hope this email finds you well....' of 2025." She jokingly asked Chad Nelson to get it fixed.*

items.title: üé¨ Loop Video Creation Tools
items.overview: Platforms supporting seamless loop video generation.

tutorial.question: *Matthieu asked if "only midjourney can do loop videos?"*
tutorial.answer: *Billy Boman clarified that "also Ray 3" supports loop functionality.*
tutorial.summary: *This brief exchange highlighted the availability of loop video features across multiple platforms for creators needing seamless looping content.*

items.title: üé¨ Jordan Daniel Chesney - Commercial Series

items.description: Jordan Daniel Chesney shared videos from "another in a series of commercials coming soon" with the notable addition "and no NDA üòÇ" - indicating he can share the work publicly. The commercials represent professional client work that demonstrates the maturity of AI video for commercial applications.

items.description: Yonatan shared the trailer his team created for Shawn Ryan's new show 'Psyop.' KƒìkƒÅ expressed interest in hearing "hot takes from this group" on the work. The project represents high-profile collaboration between AI creators and traditional entertainment industry figures.

items.title: üé¨ Winston Mayo - Christian Movies Project
items.overview: First AI scene completed for Christian film project.
items.description: Winston Mayo announced finishing his "first Ai scene" for a project addressing Christian movies, asking for community feedback. The project tackles a specific genre and demonstrates AI's potential for independent faith-based content creation.

items.overview: Showcase of work presented at Adobe MAX conference.
items.description: Billy Boman shared David Clark's work from Adobe MAX, calling it "incredible work." Jordan Daniel Chesney also praised it as "incredibly cool." Aaron Bhugobaun spotted someone in the work. The showcase represented the quality of AI creative work being presented at major industry conferences.

items.title: üé¨ Viral 3D/AI Hybrid Work
items.overview: Seamless blend of traditional 3D and AI video techniques goes viral.
items.description: A piece combining traditional 3D work with AI video generation went viral, demonstrating the power of hybrid workflows. The work showcased how traditional and AI techniques can complement each other for enhanced creative output.

items.overview: Short film project using Wonder Studios platform.
items.description: Alex shared progress on a short film created using Wonder Studios, demonstrating the platform's capabilities for narrative AI filmmaking. The project represents continued exploration of AI tools for storytelling.

items.title: üé¨ Reza Bird - AI Commercial Work
items.overview: Commercial AI video work from experienced creator.
items.description: Reza Bird shared commercial work created with AI tools, demonstrating professional-grade output for client projects. The work represents the growing acceptance of AI-generated content in commercial advertising.

items.title: üé® Ari Kuschnir - Process Interview
items.overview: Viral content creator breaks down techniques in Daniel Pinchbeck class.
items.description: Ari Kuschnir, whose work has gone viral multiple times, was interviewed about his creative process in Daniel Pinchbeck's class. The interview provided insights into the techniques and workflows behind consistently successful AI content creation.

items.title: üé¨ Brilliant Storytelling Piece (Unknown Creator)
items.overview: Viral AI storytelling piece seeking attribution.
items.description: A brilliant AI storytelling piece went viral, but the original creator remained unknown. The community discussed the work's quality and attempted to identify the artist, highlighting ongoing challenges with attribution in viral AI content.

items.title: üé® PJ Accetturo - Photorealistic AI Images
items.overview: Hiring for Nov/Dec photorealistic image generation work.
items.description: PJ Accetturo announced he's looking to hire someone for photorealistic AI image generation work in November and December. The opportunity represents professional paid work in AI image creation, demonstrating the growing market for specialized AI creative skills.

items.title: üé¨ Linus Ekenstam Joins RealDreams
items.overview: Industry OG and prominent AI creator joins the community.
items.description: Linus Ekenstam, described by multiple members as an "OG" in the AI filmmaking space, joined the RealDreams community. His addition represents a significant milestone, bringing extensive experience and industry connections. Community members expressed excitement about his participation, with several noting his influential role in the AI creative space.

items.title: üé¨ Anya Neuhaus Joins RealDreams
items.overview: Netflix/DreamWorks/Wonder Studios veteran joins the community.
items.description: Anya Neuhaus, with background at Netflix, DreamWorks, and Wonder Studios, joined the RealDreams community. Her addition brings traditional entertainment industry expertise and connections to the group. Community members welcomed her experience in both traditional and AI-powered animation and filmmaking.

items.title: üé¨ Editor as New Creative Director Paradigm
items.overview: Discussion on shifting creative roles in AI filmmaking era.
items.description: A significant discussion emerged around the concept of "editor as the new Creative Director" in AI filmmaking. The conversation explored how traditional creative hierarchies are shifting, with editors taking on more creative decision-making power as AI tools democratize content generation. This represents a fundamental rethinking of creative workflows and team structures.

items.title: üè¢ Enterprise AI Workflow Challenges
items.overview: Discussion on barriers to AI adoption in corporate environments.
items.description: Community members discussed the challenges of implementing AI workflows in enterprise settings. Key barriers include tool complexity, lack of integration with existing software, and corporate IT restrictions. The Weavy-Figma integration was highlighted as addressing many of these concerns by working within existing corporate infrastructure.

items.title: üé® Weavy vs Traditional VFX Workflows
items.overview: Comparison of AI-powered and traditional VFX approaches.
items.description: Discussion compared Weavy's nodal AI workflow approach to traditional VFX tools like Nuke and Houdini. Community members noted that creatives familiar with compositing and node-based workflows can quickly adapt to Weavy, while it also makes complex AI workflows more accessible to those without technical backgrounds.

items.title: üé¨ Sora 2 Pro Quality Concerns
items.overview: Community discusses quality issues with Sora 2 Pro tier.
items.description: Several community members expressed concerns about Sora 2 Pro quality not meeting expectations, particularly compared to promotional materials. Discussions covered consistency issues, character representation challenges, and the gap between marketing and actual output. The conversation highlighted ongoing challenges in AI video generation quality and consistency.

items.title: üí∞ Production Pricing - Tool Costs
items.overview: Discussion on budgeting for AI tools in production workflows.
items.description: Community members discussed the costs of various AI tools and how to budget for them in production workflows. The conversation covered subscription tiers, API costs, and strategies for managing expenses across multiple platforms. This represents growing maturity in understanding the economics of AI-powered production.

items.title: üé® Consistency Techniques Discussion
items.overview: Ongoing conversation about maintaining visual consistency across generations.
items.description: Extended discussion on techniques for maintaining visual consistency across AI video generations. Topics included character consistency, style transfer, and tools like Seedream for maintaining coherent visual language across shots. The conversation highlighted this as one of the most important ongoing challenges in AI filmmaking.

items.title: üé® Freepik Node System Coming
items.overview: Freepik announces upcoming node-based workflow system.
items.description: Discussion of Freepik's announcement of an upcoming node-based workflow system, joining the trend toward nodal AI workflows. The move represents broader industry adoption of node-based approaches for AI creative tools, following the success of platforms like Weavy and ComfyUI.

items.title: üë• RealDreams Community Growth
items.overview: Community reaches 280 members milestone.
items.description: The RealDreams community reached 280 members, representing significant growth and the addition of influential industry figures like Linus Ekenstam and Anya Neuhaus. The milestone reflects the community's growing importance as a hub for professional AI filmmaking discussion and collaboration.

items.title: üé¨ Adobe Firefly Video Timeline
items.overview: Discussion on Adobe's AI video generation timeline and features.
items.description: Community members discussed Adobe Firefly Video's development timeline and expected features. Questions remained about when full functionality would be available and how it would compare to existing AI video tools. The conversation reflected anticipation around Adobe's entry into AI video generation.

items.description: Community members discussed presentations and developments from SIGGRAPH Hong Kong, particularly related to AI filmmaking and visual effects. The conference showcased cutting-edge research and techniques being developed in the AI creative space.

items.description: Community members discussed the latest updates to Cursor, an AI-powered coding assistant. The tool represents growing integration of AI into development workflows, with potential applications for automating aspects of AI filmmaking pipelines.
